KUfB1eUpDYSrJUWKqD-LTA.text: Upscale Italian place on Club Street. The food is consistently good across the board but not spectacular. Specific details based on our order below:- Bread basket - ok / standard good. What you would expect from this type of restaurant- Burrata - Ok - good quality of burrata cheese though I definitely have had better -creamier, fresher than this one elsewhere in Singapore. The accompanying parma ham and veggie are good though- Shrimp starter - good but nothing outstanding - high quality shrimp - grilled well - served on an eggplant puree with zucchini- 1M Pappardelle with Ragu - one of their signature dishes. Ok. The pasta is al dente and the meter long is appetizing. However, the Ragu is lacking / underwhelming and the sauce does not fully come together with the pasta- Spaghetti with lobster in tomato sauce - also ok. The dish is very tomato-y. While the tomato is fresh and tasty, it overpowered the entire dish. I wish there was a better balance with the diff ingredients- Seabass - cooked very well. Perfectly crispy skin and the right texture on the fish. - Tiramisu - ok / standard goodService is a mixed bag - some ppl are nicer / more attentive than others.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore

P8BL6YVx4NweqDn9HfvKiA.text: I was taken here on a Saturday night, and we didn't sit in the open-air courtyard, but instead in the ACed interior, which was tastefully decorated. We were seated at a round table which was a bit awkward for two people. The friendly Sicilian sommelier recommended a great white for us to go with our meal. For starters, we got the prawns and the burrata, which was a bit of a happy mistake for me. The burrata came with 8 slices of ham, rocket, and cherry tomatoes while my companion only got 2 prawns! Needless to say I needed some help to finish my burrata. Perhaps it should have been shared between 2 people. The prawns were large and crunchy, very delicious, while the burrata was good, but not as soft as I'd like. My companion was very hungry and suggested we share a pasta, the Pappardelle Xxlong, with wild boar ragout. I wasn't too sure about the choice, but it sounded fun - a meter-long pappardelle... sure. They had split the portion for us to share, so I had a 0.5m long pappardelle instead. I wasn't expecting it, but I was completely blown away when I bit into the pasta. It was perfectly cooked, with enough bite, and not at all mushy, with just the right thickness. The ragout was good and the boar/pork was soft, but I could have eaten the pasta in any other sauce and finished it. I would definitely come back just for this dish. We both got the lamb rack each for our mains, and it came with carrot purée and a rosemary garlic crumble which I really enjoyed. The lamb was cooked exactly the way I wanted - medium rare. What I found strange about this main, was that my companion's lamb had 4 ribs in total, while mine had 6! I swapped out 3 ribs for 2, so we would have an equal amount of meat. It was funny how the entire night I kept having a gargantuan portion relative to my companion's. I finished the meal with the chocolate explosion, which the waitstaff kindly handed me the dessert menu before I finished my main. The chocolate explosion required 15 mins wait, which was good timing. It turned out to be a chocolate lava cake with vanilla ice cream and berries. The interior of the lava cake was flowy and molten. Absolutely delicious with the ice cream, which presumably was of decent quality, with no pesky ice crystals' crunching.Would I return? Yes! And have the pappardelle all to myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Chocolate explosion
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Lamb chops main
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. 1m xxlong pappardelle, half portion.

evfld9WASAsPnEHnKFfY7g.text: Senso used to be one of the better Italian eateries in Singapore when it first opened. Now, there are at least a dozen restaurants where the food is better, more creative, or both. Yet, prices are at the same level as the best in town. Service is competent, but old-fashioned and not pro-active. Sure, the patio is nice and the ambience pleasant, but I'd rather have the better food at Braci, Osteria Arte, Garibaldi, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore

qDzs5ISTCg3AyD8TJEeFOA.text: This is really nice. Location is very central and in the heart of hip Club Street. Set in a conservation shophouse, the front houses a bar where you can have drinks and there is a good wine list. In the heart is a courtyard for alfresco dining but for our party we had the private dining space in air conditioned comfort. Service here is excellent and the food as expected to be delicious. I chose scallops for my starter which was fantastic and the lamb rack which was beautifully done to mediumness. While I've had better panna cotta elsewhere, it was still good here and as it was my birthday, the restaurant arranged a special treat of their  tiramisu.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore

-8TyZ18de9ShBu3DI5jFAQ.text: They do an excellent brunch here with quality ingredients and attentive service. European atmosphere with white tablecloth linens. Today was my third visit to Senso and I have never been disappointed. I will definitely come for their prosecco brunch again.

yvkWa-uosgKdF9UuuagcKQ.text: The restaurant is pretty and nicely decorated. It is a good place for a date or other special events. The Italian food is superb! I would recommend a few including lamb ribs, squid ink pasta and tiramisu. Service is great, you will be well served after entering the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Tiramisu
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Squid ink pasta!
Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Lamb ribs! SuperB!

ms2jy7eQbSFtTRxL395h_Q.text: Well, that didn't take long. Returned the next day, exceptional hare and pumpkin risotto. My Italian lunching partner loved his fresh pasta. Another member of staff spoke French (is this place French run?).Still 5* to me. Still my go to lunch spot in Telok Ayer.

V9CzA3O6LUxi89tZnsIFow.text: Had a birthday party here. Nice wines good desserts. Good service in a more colonial setting. Courtyard garden. We had fish, beef in thick brown sauce and tasty italian breads. Our host had the tables full and we had the whole restaurant to ourselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Senso Ristorante & Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Party here today

Lm8EgXEy80-mgOYFH8vKXA.text: This place is nice.Like, really nice.A comfortable, impeccable service kind of nice.A step inside and immediately find a secret courtyard in the city kind of nice.A pleasantly dim and dark interior dining room kind of nice.It's so nice that it kind of all just evens out. My tagliatelle was so perfect it got kind of bland. That sounds bad. What I mean is, because of the price and environment, your expectations are hitting a whole new level and I'm not sure Senso reaches them. I think that's what the other reviewers are getting at. If you want a wonderfully executed modern Italian lunch, then by all means come here. If you're iffy about spending $40 on it, I can't promise you'll feel like it was worth it.

vyaU5T7eoqJccMm9HzUPLg.text: Review for the Sunday prosecco brunch. Really nice experience for a weekend getaway from the kids. Service is stellar. The buffet spread is decent with some high points (chilled shrimp, different cheeses and nice little shot glasses of soup) and a few misses (no omelette bar and not such a great selection of oysters), but the made-to-order small plate menu earns the fifth star. You will be hard pressed to find a better deal in Singapore for the price. You can dine inside, which has chilly AC or al fresco in the courtyard. Senso also takes part in the entertainer program.

CT1dzJaUAbxdeHxhxj0uUw.text: A very pretty restaurant with some great Italian food!Everything we ordered was very tasty and the service seemed to be very good, although got very spotty as the restaurant became busy with big groups.They were kind enough to give me a pillow for my back so I am more comfortable and the food was very tasty, although definitely on the pricier side.

LqzEp9DjF6A_U1H1H2EuRw.text: Two sad-looking seared scallops plopped into an under-seasoned cream soup, lumpy polenta in a sauce that had separated, strange "fruit minestrone" and acrid olive oil. Service was good, however, I was offered tea three or four times and the mignardises zero times. I guess they forgot.

BkSh981OKFoPcszpKZQ8Og.text: Went here for a business lunch. Fancy interior, nice service and pretty good value for executive lunch ($40S three courses and coffee with chocolates at the end).The quality of food was so-so, bordering on mediocre. I had a veal carpaccio which was bad, smothered with rather odd liver-tasting sauce, lamb cutlets for main which was competent and a 'minestrone of berries' which was berries in sugary liquid, not so good. Chocolates and coffee at end was pleasant but the coffee was drip, no offer for espresso or with milk.Its not a great place, but passable for a quick business lunch. Dinner is much more expensive and. given the quality, not worth it.
